lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Gur Dhaavat Baraji Raakhai , Nihachal Chit Soukh Sahaji Nivaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The unique servant of the True Guru keeps the wandering mind under control by taking the refuge of the Guru and practicing meditation on the consecrated words of the Guru. His mind becomes stable and he rests in the comfort of his self (soul).

lines.gurmukhi: jIvn kI Awsw Aru mrn kI icMqw imtI jIvn mukiq gurmiq ko pRgws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jeevan Kee Aasaa Aru Maran Kee Chintaa Mitee , Jeevan Moukati Gurmati Ko Pragaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He loses the desire for a long life and fear of death disappears. He becomes free of all worldly bonds while still alive. The teachings and wisdom of the Guru takes over his mind.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpw Koie honhwru hoie soeI Blo mwnY syvw srbwqm kY dwsn ko dws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapaa Khoi Honahaaru Hoi Soee Bhalo Maanai , Sayvaa Sarabaatam Kai Daasan Ko Daas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He discards and destroys his self-assertion and accepts the dispensation of the Almighty as fair and just. He serves all living beings and thus becomes a slave of the slaves.

lines.transliteration_english: Sree Gur Daras Sabad Braham Giaan Dhiaana , Pooran Sarabamaee Braham Bisvaas Hai ?281?

Shabad OS B.translation: By practicing the words of Guru, he acquires the divine knowledge and contemplation. And thus he is assured that the perfect God Lord pervades in all. (281)
